column1: Huanren Manchu Autonomous County (simplified Chinese: 桓仁满族自治县; traditional Chinese: 桓仁滿族自治縣; pinyin: Huánrén Mǎnzú Zìzhì Xìan
column2: Manchu: ᡥᡠᠸᠠᠨᡵᡝᠨᠮᠠᠨᠵᡠᠪᡝᠶᡝᡩᠠᠰᠠᠩᡤᠠᠰᡳᠶᠠᠨ; Mölendroff: huwanren manju beye dasangga siyan)
column4: is a county under the administration of Benxi City
column7: bordering Jilin to the east. It is also one of 11 Manchu autonomous counties and one of 117 autonomous counties nationally. As a county
column8: Huanren was established in 1877. It was reorganised as an autonomous county in 1989 with approval of the State Council. The county covers 3
column12: and Huanren Town is its seat.

column1: Huanren County is divided into 13 Subdivisions: one subdistrict
column2: eight towns and four townships including one ethnic township. The main nationalities are Manchu

column1: Huanren has a monsoon-influenced humid continental climate (Köppen Dwa) with hot and humid summers and rather long
column3: and very dry winters. More than two-thirds of the annual rainfall occurs from June thru August. Monthly 24-hour average temperatures range from −12.4 °C (9.7 °F) in January to 23.0 °C (73.4 °F) in July

column2: a Goguryeo site found in this county
column3: is part of the combined UNESCO World Heritage Site that also includes sites in Ji'an
